#AI will accelerate that trend. 

We offer a FREE technology services assessment and tips to reduce costs while boosting performance. We can help you find AI infrastructure and managed services quickly. Reach out today!

posts.name:
startupshivay
startupshivay
posts.content: Apple has reached a settlement of $95 million in a class-action lawsuit concerning privacy violations related to its Siri voice-activated assistant. The lawsuit brought forward claims that Apple frequently recorded users' private conversations without their consent when Siri was unintentionally activated. Furthermore, it was alleged that this recorded data was shared with advertisers. As part of the settlement, affected users are expected to receive compensation, potentially amounting to $20 for each Siri-enabled device they own. This settlement highlights ongoing concerns regarding user privacy and data management practices in technology.

posts.name:
Srihari Srikanth, CSCP
Srihari Srikanth, CSCP
posts.content:
Unlocking the Power of SAP MM Purchase Info Record (PIR) 
The Purchase Info Record (PIR) in SAP MM is essential for efficient procurement. It links materials with vendors, storing critical details like pricing, delivery terms, and order history.
Why is PIR Important?
Centralized Information: All vendor-material details are in one place.
Automation: Simplifies Purchase Order creation.
Vendor Insights: Tracks historical data for performance analysis.
Key Features:
Store pricing and delivery terms.
Automate procurement processes.
Enhance decision-making with accurate data.
Mastering PIR can streamline your procurement process and drive operational efficiency!

posts.name:
Neil Sarkar
Neil Sarkar
posts.content:
When I first started in sales, I assumed a ‚Äústrong pipeline‚Äù meant a stellar forecast. Spoiler: not always true. Pipelines and forecasts are related but serve different purposes in your sales strategy.

Pipeline = Present 

Shows where every deal stands right now. 
Tools like Salesforce‚Äôs Kanban board help ensure no lead goes unattended.Ô∏è

Forecast = Future 

Predicts which deals will close‚Äîand when. 
Salesforce‚Äôs forecasting tools highlight risks and guide resource allocationÔ∏è

Why Both Matter 
Pipeline is your snapshot; forecast is your crystal ball. 
No forecast? No clue which deals will realistically convert. 
No pipeline? You‚Äôre forecasting in the dark. 

Meet
AI to keep your pipeline squeaky clean and forecasts accurate. 
Translation: less time stuck in spreadsheets, more time closing deals. 

TAKEAWAY 
Master your pipeline (the present) and your forecast (the future) to build an unstoppable sales engine. 

Got questions on Salesforce or want to level up your sales game? Drop a comment or DM me. Let‚Äôs turn chaos into clarity‚Äîone deal at a time!

posts.name:
Brian LaManna
Brian LaManna
posts.content:
Steal this tip I've seen every President's Club seller master.

Every seller should be doing it.

Very few do.


Never go between 2 meetings, without getting a 'touch' out.

Here's what I refer to all of them as.

"No-ask, value touches"


It's building value, without putting homework onto your prospect's plate.


Here's how you can find one.

ùóöùóº ùòÅùóº ùóöùóºùóºùó¥ùóπùó≤ ùó°ùó≤ùòÑùòÄ, ùòÅùóµùó≤ùó∂ùóø ùòÄùóºùó∞ùó∂ùóÆùóπ, ùóÆùóªùó± ùóøùó≤ùòÉùó∂ùó≤ùòÑ ùòÜùóºùòÇùóø ùóπùóÆùòÄùòÅ ùó∞ùóÆùóπùóπ:

-Any rapport you built?
-Any company news come up?
-What stood out to them the most?
-What questions did they ask last call?
-What's their LI page or blog posting about?

ùóßùóµùó≤ùóª ùòÜùóºùòÇ ùó∞ùóÆùóª ùòÄùóµùóÆùóøùó≤:

-A case study
-An article you found
-A video on one of their questions 
-Non-work related, from rapport you built



ùó¶ùóÆùó∫ùóΩùóπùó≤ ùó™ùó≤ùó≤ùó∏:

Monday: Discovery call + follow up

Wednesday: Share a case study from 1st conversation

Thursday: Add them on LinkedIn

Friday: Crush demo



Anything to win mind share for a few min is a huge win.

While closing this deal is your #1 priority

It's your prospect's 30th priority

Always be adding value 


P.S. Partnered with Gong on a video series. Here's how I resurrect closed-lost opps:

comments.commentText: "While closing this deal is your #1 priority. It's your prospect's 30th priority."  So true, great way to put things in perspective!

Making every touch-point value adding increases win rates from my experience.

Instead of the traditional:

- circling back
- touch base
- following-up

Make your prospects feel special by saying things like:

''I came to think about your case when I came across this piece of article, so thought it would be good to share it with you as well''
